alert.note: Alert for Frontier (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:04PM CDT until September 09 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN FRONTIER AND EASTERN HAYES COUNTIES... At 703 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hayes Center, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 700 PM CDT, golf ball size hail was reported two miles north of Hayes Center. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hayes Center, Quick, Bluegill Haven Campground, Marengo, Hayes Center State Wildlife Management Area, and Red Willow Reservoir State Recreation Area. This includes Highway 83 between mile markers 32 and 40. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte.
